item.title: 亚马逊与美国联邦贸易委员会就 Prime 订阅案达成 25 亿美元协议
item.description: 亚马逊公司（Amazon.com Inc. ）同意支付 25 亿美元的罚款和退款，并改变其取消 Prime 订阅的程序，以解决美国联邦贸易委员会的诉讼。【原文：Amazon.com Inc. agreed to pay $2.5 billion in penalties and refunds and change its process for how to cancel its Prime subscription to settle a lawsuit by the US Federal Trade Commission.】

item.title: 纳米比亚将欧洲债券再融资任务授予三家本地银行
item.description: 纳米比亚财政部已指定三家国内贷款机构帮助其筹集约 1.22 亿美元，为下个月到期的 7.5 亿美元欧元债券的一部分再融资。【原文：Namibia’s Finance Ministry has appointed three domestic lenders to help it raise about $122 million to refinance a portion of its $750 million eurobond due next month.】

item.title: 欧洲 9 月债券销售额突破 2,000 亿欧元，创历史新高
item.description: 随着从主权国家到高收益公司的借款人充分利用有利条件，欧洲公共债务市场的发行量创下了 9 月份的新纪录。【原文：Issuance in Europe’s public debt market has set a new September record as borrowers from sovereigns to high-yield companies make the most of favorable conditions.】

item.title: 不可替代 "的创始人马克-莱昂纳德辞职，Constellation 软件公司业绩下滑
item.description: 加拿大第二大科技公司 Constellation Software Inc. 的创始人兼总裁马克-伦纳德（Mark Leonard）周四表示，由于健康原因，他将立即辞职。这一消息导致该公司股价下滑，评级也随之下调。【原文：Mark Leonard, founder and president of Canada’s second-largest tech company Constellation Software Inc., is resigning immediately for health reasons, the company said Thursday. The announcement sent the firm’s shares sliding and prompted a downgrade.】

item.title: 德尔芬液化天然气公司（Delfin LNG）希望在11月前就美国项目作出投资决定
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，路易斯安那州沿海液化天然气出口终端的紧密控股开发商 Delfin Midstream Inc.【原文：Delfin Midstream Inc., the closely held developer of a liquefied natural gas export terminal off the coast of Louisiana, is getting closer to lining up the financing it needs to move forward with the project, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: MassMutual 探索削减人寿保险风险的交易
item.description: 马萨诸塞州相互人寿保险公司正在探索一项潜在的再保险交易，以减少其人寿保险相关储备金。【原文：Massachusetts Mutual Life Insurance Co is exploring a potential reinsurance deal to reduce its life-insurance-related reserves.】

item.title: Amundi 看好英镑下跌，押注英国央行降息和重启量化宽松政策
item.description: 欧洲最大的资产管理公司正在押注英镑，因为预计英国央行将释放新一轮刺激政策，优先支持经济增长而不是抑制通胀。【原文：Europe’s largest asset manager is betting against the pound on expectations that the Bank of England will unleash a fresh wave of stimulus as it prioritizes supporting growth over taming inflation.】

item.title: 克莱因出售核电开发商股份后，Oklo 公司股价暴跌
item.description: 在宣布丘吉尔资本公司（Churchill Capital Corp.）董事迈克尔-克莱因（Michael Klein）出售了其在这家先进核反应堆开发商所持的 670 万美元股份后，Oklo 公司的股价创下了五个月来的最大跌幅。【原文：Oklo Inc. tumbled the most in five months after announcing that director Michael Klein of Churchill Capital Corp. sold $6.7 million of his shares in the developer of advanced nuclear reactors.】

item.title: 葡萄牙将提高外国买家购房税
item.description: 作为一系列旨在增加南欧国家经济适用房供应的措施的一部分，葡萄牙政府将提高非居民购房税。【原文：The Portuguese government will raise the tax on house purchases carried out by non-residents as part of a series of measures aimed at increasing the supply of affordable homes in the southern European country.】

item.title: 私人信贷巨头为巨额交易化债为股
item.description: 本周，当 Blackstone Inc. 宣布将牵头投资 70 亿美元在德克萨斯州的一家液化天然气出口工厂时，一个关键的金融巧思就隐藏在人们的视线中。虽然该公司为这笔交易注入了股权，但大部分资金将来自其庞大的私人信贷基金。【原文：When Blackstone Inc. announced it led a $7 billion investment in a liquefied natural gas export plant in Texas this week, a key piece of financial ingenuity was hiding in plain sight. While the firm is contributing equity into the deal, most of the money will come from its massive private credit funds.】

item.title: Blackstone 将向欧洲小型开发商贷款 20 亿英镑
item.description: Blackstone Inc. 的房地产债务业务已与 Pluto Finance 达成合作协议，将在两年内向欧洲的中小型开发商和房地产投资者提供 20 亿英镑（27 亿美元）的贷款。【原文：Blackstone Inc.’s real estate debt business has agreed a tie-up with Pluto Finance that will see it lend £2 billion ($2.7 billion) over two years to small and medium sized developers and property investors in Europe.】

item.title: 新英格兰爱国者队在第六街交易中估值超过 90 亿美元
item.description: 据熟悉该交易的人士透露，新英格兰爱国者队将以超过 90 亿美元的估值向 Sixth Street Partners 和亿万富翁 Dean Metropoulos 出售股份。【原文：The New England Patriots are set to sell a stake to Sixth Street Partners and billionaire Dean Metropoulos at a valuation above $9 billion, according to people familiar with the deal.】

item.title: 鲍曼称就业市场 "脆弱 "证明美联储有理由进一步降息
item.description: 美联储最高级别的银行警察米歇尔-鲍曼（Michelle Bowman）表示，由于就业市场疲软，通胀率已经接近央行的目标，因此有理由进行更多的降息。【原文：Michelle Bowman, the Federal Reserve’s top bank cop, said inflation is close enough to the central bank’s target to justify more interest rate cuts because the job market is weakening.】

item.title: 中国就关税计划向墨西哥发起贸易壁垒调查
item.description: 在拉美国家宣布计划对中国汽车和其他产品征收高达 50%的关税后，中国对墨西哥发起了贸易壁垒调查。【原文：China launched a trade barrier investigation into Mexico after the Latin American country announced plans to impose tariffs of as much as 50% on Chinese cars and other products.】

item.title: 投资者等待催化剂和通胀数据，美国股市下跌
item.description: 美国股市周四延续跌势，投资者在等待新的催化剂和一份可能影响美联储政策的通胀报告。【原文：US stocks extended declines Thursday as investors awaited fresh catalysts and an inflation report that may shape Federal Reserve policy.】

item.title: 塔夫茨大学和马萨诸塞大学医院在特朗普削减医疗开支前赢得州政府帮助
item.description: 马萨诸塞州各地的医院系统，包括该州最大的医疗服务提供商马萨诸塞大学纪念医疗中心（UMass Memorial Medical Center）和塔夫茨医疗中心（Tufts Medical Center），都准备获得 2.34 亿美元的州政府资助，以应对特朗普政府不断加深的财政压力和削减开支。【原文：Hospital systems across Massachusetts — including some of the state’s largest healthcare providers UMass Memorial Medical Center and Tufts Medical Center — are poised to receive a $234 million state funding package as they battle deepening financial strains and cutbacks from the Trump administration.】

item.title: 花旗集团在中国裁员后将近 1,000 个技术岗位迁往印度
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，花旗集团（Citigroup Inc.【原文：Citigroup Inc. has moved close to 1,000 tech jobs to India’s business support centers following cuts to its workforce in China, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 安必帕获法院紧急保护，债权人蜂拥而至
item.description: 巴西废物管理公司 Ambipar Participações e Empreendimentos SA 向法院表示，由于一些贷款人要求支付可能触发其债务交叉违约条款的款项，该公司面临财务崩溃的风险，因此获得了针对债权人的紧急保护。【原文：Brazilian waste management company Ambipar Participações e Empreendimentos SA was granted emergency protection against creditors after telling a court it was at risk of financial collapse as some lenders demanded payments that could trigger cross-default clauses on its debt.】

item.title: 乌干达开发银行考虑出售 5 亿美元外债
item.description: 国有乌干达发展银行计划在未来三年内利用国际资本市场筹集 5 亿美元，并已聘请总部位于巴黎的全球主权咨询公司（Global Sovereign Advisory）为这一进程提供指导。【原文：State-owned Uganda Development Bank plans to tap the international capital market for $500 million over the next three years and has engaged Paris-based Global Sovereign Advisory to guide the process.】

item.title: 高成本阻碍购房者，美国现房销售下滑
item.description: 8 月份，美国二手房的销售量略有下滑，这表明经济承受能力的制约因素仍在困扰着房地产市场。【原文：Sales of previously owned homes in the US slipped slightly in August, a sign that affordability constraints continue to grip the housing market.】

item.title: 加拿大预算监督机构认为联邦债务与国内生产总值之比上升
item.description: 根据加拿大预算监督机构的最新预测，随着赤字和债务在经济中所占比例的上升，加拿大联邦财政状况将进一步恶化。【原文：Canada’s federal fiscal picture is set to worsen as deficits and debt rise as a percentage of the economy, according to the latest forecasts from the country’s budgetary watchdog.】

item.title: 法国市场监察机构认为该国正在躲避金融危机
item.description: 在政治动荡引发一周内两次信用评级下调之后，法国证券监管机构负责人驳斥了人们对该国正面临潜在金融危机的担忧。【原文：The head of France’s securities regulator dismissed concerns the country is facing a potential financial crisis after political instability triggered two credit downgrades within a week.】

item.title: First Brands-Linked 融资单位申请破产
item.description: 濒临破产的汽车零部件制造商 First Brands Group LLC 用于融资的一组公司已申请破产保护。【原文：A group of companies used by ailing auto-part manufacturer First Brands Group LLC to raise financing has filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection.】

item.title: 美联储主席古尔斯比称数据稳定时利率会有 "适当幅度 "下降
item.description: 芝加哥联邦储备银行行长奥斯汀-古尔斯比（Austan Goolsbee）表示，如果经济数据显示通胀有望达到央行的目标，且劳动力市场保持稳定，利率可能会进一步下调。【原文：Federal Reserve Bank of Chicago President Austan Goolsbee said interest rates could come down further if economic data shows inflation is on track to reach the central bank’s target and the labor market remains steady.】

item.title: CoreWeave 将与 OpenAI 的交易额扩大到 224 亿美元之多
item.description: CoreWeave 公司将其向 OpenAI 提供数据中心容量的协议扩大了 65 亿美元之多，总额达到 224 亿美元，这是最新的一笔交易，凸显了全球对人工智能计算容量的巨大需求。【原文：CoreWeave Inc. has expanded its agreements to supply data center capacity to OpenAI by as much as $6.5 billion to a total of $22.4 billion, the latest deal to underscore the immense demand worldwide for AI computing capacity.】

item.title: 据说 Blackstone、Warburg 将争夺 CVC 支持的 Sebia 的股份
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，黑石、华平和北欧资本等私募股权投资竞标者都希望投资法国诊断服务提供商 Sebia，该公司的估值可能在 50 亿欧元左右。【原文：Blackstone, Warburg Pincus and Nordic Capital are among private equity bidders looking to invest in French diagnostics provider Sebia, which could be valued at around €5 billion, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 价格飙升后，沙特阿拉伯下令冻结利雅得房租
item.description: 沙特王储穆罕默德-本-萨勒曼（Mohammed bin Salman）在誓言制止 "不可接受的 "房地产价格上涨几周后，下令在未来五年内冻结首都利雅得的房租上涨。【原文：Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman ordered a freeze on rent increases in the capital of Riyadh for the next five years, just weeks after vowing to halt an “unacceptable” rise in property prices.】

item.title: 华尔街关注 IPO 跟踪器，新上市股票数量居 S&P 500 指数之首
item.description: 寻找华尔街下一个热门交易的股票多头们越来越多地转向今年美国市场最繁忙的角落--首次公开募股。【原文：Stock bulls looking for the next hot Wall Street trade are increasingly turning to the busiest corner of the US market this year — initial public offerings.】

item.title: 马克莱姆支持加拿大财政转型，称需要进行艰难改革
item.description: 加拿大央行行长蒂夫-马克莱姆（Tiff Macklem）对政府的基础设施支出计划表示了微妙的支持，称过去的政策制定者在提高生产率和实际收入方面做得不够。【原文：Bank of Canada Governor Tiff Macklem offered a subtle endorsement of the government’s plans to spend on infrastructure, saying policymakers in the past have not done enough to boost productivity and real incomes.】

item.title: 马斯克的 Grok 人工智能获准在美国政府机构中使用
item.description: 美国总务管理局（General Services Administration）周四宣布，埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）的xAI公司签署了一项新协议，将其人工智能聊天机器人Grok的使用权扩展到联邦政府。【原文：Elon Musk’s xAI signed a new agreement to expand access to its artificial intelligence chatbot Grok to the federal government, the General Services Administration announced Thursday.】
